title.narrative: Humanitarian response, resilience and recovery: Food security and emotional support in Lima, Peru

description.narrative: This project aims to contribute to resilience and recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic and its impacts by consolidating learning from the work and sustainability of providing food security and mental health support to families and adolescents in 2 districts of Lima, San Juan de Lurigancho and Ate. It will provide nutritious food rations for 350 people (5 rations per week; 42,240 servings) over 10 months to families and vulnerable individuals living in poverty and extreme poverty who are not in work, nor able to earn and income, including people who are isolated due to CV19, older people and those living with disabilities. This will be done via 8 ollas comunes (grassroots soup kitchens) who will be trained to strengthen their practices, access public support and skills. It will also increase the resilience and nutrition of 40 families from the ollas to set up organic vegetable gardens/composting. Finally, it will provide emotional support to 200 teenagers in need affected by the pandemic or who may have lost carers by providing training to 20 community and parish volunteers, engaging their parents/carers. This project takes part alongside a nationwide response by Caritas Peru, the diocese's own response, Bishop's Conference and in coordination with the Comprehensive Health and Food Security Commission and Lima East Health District.
